intro: Pseudobartlettia, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and extreme temperatures. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are often pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
